title: Dying Light 2
shortDescription:
Dying Light 2 is an AAA computer game combining the genres of an action role-playing game and survival horror.

I joined the team as a gameplay developer and have been supporting the UI team since last year. My responsibilities include maintaining existing systems, writing new features, fixing bugs, optimizing and working with a team of game and UI designers.

Release date: TBA

title: Dr Livingstone, I Presume?
shortDescription:
Dr. Livingstone, I suppose? is a Premium Indie title that I co-founded and still support as a developer and co-producer. It is a mix between a puzzle and FPP adventure game with a strong emphasis on the story. The action takes place in nineteenth-century Africa, when Henry Stanley is sent to search for a missing explorer - David Livingstone.

The game was built entirely in Unreal Engine 4 using C ++ and Blueprints. Working as a game programmer from the very beginning required many prototypes, especially the mechanics of individual puzzles. At the same time, I worked in a team of 2-3 people on player movement and environmental aspects - for example opening doors and drawers. One of the main pillars of the game is to reflect the player's natural movement during free exploration. Therefore, for example, cabinet doors are not opened with a click or button press, but with a mouse movement reflecting the actual movement of the hand when opening the door. Later, the basic mechanics were grouped into separate components to speed up the process of creating individual puzzles. My personal success with this project is the code architecture for UI, which solved the problems with displaying various puzzle widgets.

I work closely with game designers all the time to make sure my work is consistent with their ideas. I help them navigate the UE4 editor while tweaking parameters or testing the game.

Release date on Steam: Q2 2021

title: Jasper Runner
shortDescription:
Jasper is a 3D endless runner created for a video game making workshop. It is built entirely in Unreal Engine Blueprints. Main adjustments to the Third Person template were made to character movement and camera settings.

The level is built in the runtime by spawning new tiles (forming one continuous platform) and destroying the ones that character already moved past. Player controls left and right movement of the character and has control also when the character is jumping.

The goal of the game is to achieve as many meters as possible without running into an obstacle or falling down from the platform.

title: Toy Tanks Battle
shortDescription:
A Toy Tank simulator where you and your opponent are placed in a battle arena and try to simply hit the opposite tank as many times as possible and at the same time avoid being shot. Programmed in Unreal Engine 4 using C++ with little support of Blueprints to avoid hardcoding actors' names.

Movement, shooting and basic AI were implemented. AI tanks use NavMesh to follow the Player and inside logic to shoot efficiently. A player plays his tank as he likes :) Arena was sculptured with UE Landscape Tools. Particles were modified from UE basic content.

title: Catch The Duck
shortDescription:
Game created some time ago using the DirectX 9 SDK. Made me appreciate game engines :)

The goal of the game is to catch four birds (yellow ball), the next bird spawns randomly in the city after the previous one is hit. Height and number of buildings are generated from a file. Birds AI fly around the city using Blackboards. Collisions were built from scratch. The bullet physics were designed and implemented with pure math and Newton physics. Skybox and some textures were added for more pleasant gameplay. The game produces a verbose log file.
